title: Quiz 2: Economics, HR & Supplies Management
description: Focuses on budgeting, human resources, procurement laws, and supply chain logistics.

questions.question: In Health Economics, what is the key difference between 'Need' and 'Demand'?

options.text: Need involves money; Demand does not.
Demand is subjective; Need is objective.
Demand is backed by ability to pay (money); Need is a subjective idea.

questions.explanation: Demand is 'effective demand' because it is expressed by spending money. Needs are subjective ideas where money is not necessarily a factor.

questions.question: The document that shows all receipts and payments of cash in government accounting is called the ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: A Cashbook shows all receipts and payments of cash.
questions.hint: It is a book recording cash.

questions.question: Order the steps in the Performance Management process:
questions.explanation: The cycle starts with defining the role and ends with the formal review.
questions.hint: You must define the job before you can review it.

questions.question: Which of the following are classified as 'Visible Money' (Cash) available to a health facility? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Visible money is seen/handled (Fees, Donations, Fund raising). Invisible money is paper credit (AIE, Allocations).
questions.hint: Money you can physically hold or bank directly.

questions.question: Match the Procurement Entity Class with its examples:
questions.explanation: Class A = Ministries; Class B = Provincial level/Colleges; Class C = District Hospitals/Schools.
questions.hint: Think of the hierarchy: Ministries are at the top.

questions.question: Review the table below regarding budgeting. Which budgeting method focuses on 'Outputs' and 'Results'?

richContent.content:
Method AMethod B
Focus on InputsFocus on Outputs/Results
Control of fundsPerformance Measures
Line ItemsActivities/Tasks

questions.explanation: Programme Based Budgeting (PBB) focuses on outputs, results, and performance measures, unlike Line Item budgeting which focuses on inputs.
questions.hint: It links resources to specific programmes and results.

questions.question: What is the quorum for a Tender Committee meeting (including the Chairman)?
questions.explanation: The regulations state the quorum for a Tender Committee is 5 members including the Chairman.
questions.hint: It is the number of fingers on one hand.

questions.question: Recruitment is the process of choosing the most suitable candidate, while Selection is the process of attracting applicants.
questions.explanation: It is the reverse: Recruitment searches/attracts applicants; Selection chooses the best candidate.
questions.hint: You must recruit a pool of people before you can select one.

questions.question: Which HR concept involves the 'influence of a rater's general impression' (e.g., liking a person) affecting the rating of specific traits during appraisal?
questions.explanation: The Halo Effect occurs when a general impression biases the rating of specific performance areas.
questions.hint: Like seeing an angel's ring above their head.

questions.question: Which committee is responsible for inspecting and testing goods received to ensure compliance with the contract?
questions.explanation: The Inspection and Acceptance Committee inspects goods, ensures technical standards are met, and accepts/rejects deliveries.
questions.hint: Their name describes their two main actions upon delivery.
